comment.name: Comment
comment.title: Go Explore.
comment.text:
We caught a bit of sunshine this afternoon and temperatures rose to the high twenties, making for some fun laps on the slopes.

We can't wait to get back out there on Tuesday. The Grooming team will spend the night on the slopes doing their thing; get here early to sink your edges into some quality corduroy on most open terrain. If natural trails are more your speed, all tree skiing areas are open and ready for you to explore. Temperatures are forecasted to reach the high twenties again, and there's a chance of snowfall.

The plan is to spin 12 lifts throughout the day, starting at 8:00am. See you on first chair.

Timbertown Open Every Day
Timbertown Quad and all associated terrain are scheduled to open daily throughout the month of February, giving you more beginner and intermediate options to ski and ride. Head that way to check out Loon's newest terrain.

Drop in.
Five parks are open with over 70 features, ready for you to drop in. Loon Mountain Park had a few features swapped out on Friday night, head that way to check out what's new. Find large features and the 18' Superpipe in Loon Mountain Park, Medium Features in Springboard and Little Sister, small features in the Progression Park, and natural features in Lil' Stash.

Your Responsibility Code #1
Always Stay in control. You must be able to stop or avoid people or objects.
Your responsibility code highlights the tips and tricks you need for a safe day on the mountain. Read it, and live it on hill. Find more information on mountain safety here.
